prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) **Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system using the following vertices: - Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.0) - Line 2: (0.75, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.5937) - Line 3: (0.75, 0.5937) to (0.0, 0.5937) - Line 4: (0.0, 0.5937) to (0.0, 0.0) This sketch has one face (face\\_1), which consists of one loop (loop\\_1), which in turn consists of four lines (line\\_1 to line\\_4). **Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, using the same coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, which is the final shape of this part. The height, width, and length of this part are all 0.75 units. Congratulations, you have successfully constructed the first part of the CAD assembly. Please follow the same process for each subsequent part as described in the CAD assembly JSON.</description>
